prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Alita was a nurse that used to work with the victim who was a doctor. She is describing here whereabouts on the day the a shooting happened in the victim's clinic.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: Future stage magician in training. Apparently, the daughter of Phoenix Wright.
Character 2
Name: Dr. Hickfield
Description: A suspicious-looking fellow, though he apparently is Mr. Wright's physician.
Character 3
Name: Guy Eldoon
Description: Proprietor of the noodle stand "Eldoon's Noodles".
Character 4
Name: Plum Kitaki
Description: Wife to the 4th Kitaki Family boss. Busy cleaning up paint spilled by her front gate.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Alita Tiala
Description: Mysterious woman encountered outside People Park. She seemed concerned...
Character 6
Name: ??? → Ema Skye
Description: Detective in a white lab coat. Apparently in an extremely touchy mood.
Character 7
Name: Wocky Kitaki
Description: The defendant. Heir to the Kitaki Family empire, and Alita Tiala's fiancé.
Character 8
Name: ??? → Klavier Gavin
Description: Spitting image of Mr. Gavin. Blew in like the wind and left like the wind.
Character 9
Name: Pal Meraktis
Description: The victim. Director of the Meraktis Clinic. Died pulling the noodle stand.
Character 10
Name: Winfred Kitaki
Description: 4th Boss of the Kitaki Family. Wocky's father. Wears an apron. (Don't ask.)
Character 11
Name: Wesley Stickler
Description: Junior in Science at Ivy University. The witness. A man concerned with "truth".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Map
Description: Shows the area around Mr. Wright's office. Click here for details.
Evidence 2
Name: Bowl
Description: Custom-made Eldoon's Noodles bowl. Decorated with the Eldoon's Noodles mascot.
Evidence 3
Name: Slippers
Description: Slippers for patients at the Meraktis Clinic. Was found in front of Kitaki Mansion. Slippers used by patients at the Meraktis Clinic. Big toe print found in left slipper.
Evidence 4
Name: Mirror
Description: Torn off the car that hit Mr. Wright. Was found in front of Kitaki Mansion. Torn off the car that hit Mr. Wright. Fits car at the Meraktis Clinic.
Evidence 5
Name: Cell Phone
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic garage beneath a car. Who could have dropped it? Found in the Meraktis Clinic garage beneath a car. Property of Wesley Stickler.
Evidence 6
Name: Trucy's Panties
Description: Prop for performing magic. Found in exhaust pipe of a car at the Meraktis Clinic.
Evidence 7
Name: Letter of Request
Description: Letter of request from Alita Tiala for the legal defense of her fiancé, Wocky Kitaki.
Evidence 8
Name: White Powder → Fingerprint Powder
Description: Mysterious white powder with the alleged ability to improve Detective Skye's mood. A memento of Wright and Skye. Examine fingerprints to detect and match prints.
Evidence 9
Name: Bloomers → Little Plum's Bloomers
Description: Found in a trash can at People Park. Distinctive bloomers, to say the least. Found in a trash can at People Park. Stolen by Wesley Stickler.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Also known as a "shiv". Found at the crime scene bearing Wocky's prints.
Evidence 11
Name: Meraktis's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: June 14, after 10 PM. Cause of death: Single bullet to the right temple.
Evidence 12
Name: Noodle Stand
Description: Mr. Eldoon's noodle stand. Victim died pulling it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wocky's Check-Up Report
Description: Results from a check-up performed in June. Metallic object found near heart.
Evidence 14
Name: Pistol
Description: Weapon left at the crime scene. Two rounds were fired. Fingerprints were wiped.
Evidence 15
Name: Detective Skye's Orders
Description: "Allow clinic access to this magician and attorney, in Prosecutor Gavin's name."
Evidence 16
Name: Sandals → Alita's Sandals
Description: Cute women's sandals. Found in the Meraktis Clinic foyer. Women's sandals found in the Meraktis Clinic foyer. Big toe print found on left sandal. Present from Wocky, found in Meraktis Clinic foyer. Big toe print found on left sandal.
Evidence 17
Name: Lamp
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic office with a broken bulb and a red stain on the cord.
Evidence 18
Name: Wocky's Chart
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic safe.  Signed by nurse Alita Tiala.
Evidence 19
Name: Bullet
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic safe. Squished from impact with the back of the safe.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I did go to the clinic that day. My first time in half a year, since I quit in January.
Person: Alita
Testimony 1
Testimony: I went to warn him. After all, I knew Wocky had the pistol.
Person: Alita
Testimony 2
Testimony: The doctor always was a timid man... too timid to admit his own mistake.
Person: Alita
Testimony 3
Testimony: Why else would I have gone? I'm not hiding any dark secrets.
Person: Alita
Testimony 4
Testimony: Why would I go to the clinic now for a half-year-old chart?
Person: Alita
Testimony 5
Testimony: I wanted to tell him to be careful, as an old friend.
Person: Alita
Testimony 6
Testimony: Nothing happened at all. I warned him, and left.
Person: Alita

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. So, the user provided a bunch of characters, evidences, and testimonies from Alita. The task is to find a pair where the evidence directly contradicts one of Alita's testimonies.

First, I'll go through each of Alita's testimonies to see what she's claiming. Let's list them out:

Testimony 0: She went to the clinic that day for the first time in half a year since quitting in January. So she's saying she hadn't been there since January until that day.

Testimony 1: She went to warn the doctor because Wocky had the pistol.

Testimony 2: The doctor was too timid to admit his mistake.

Testimony 3: She's saying why else would she go if she's not hiding dark secrets. Maybe implying her reason was straightforward.

Testimony 4: She questions why she would go now for a half-year-old chart.

Testimony 5: She wanted to warn him as an old friend.

Testimony 6: Nothing happened, she just warned him and left.

Now, looking at the evidence. Let me check if any of the evidence directly contradicts her statements. Let's look at the evidence list:

Evidence 18: Wocky's Chart found in the clinic safe, signed by nurse Alita Tiala. The chart was found in the safe. But according to Testimony 4, she's saying why would she go to the clinic now (at the time of the incident) for a half-year-old chart. But if the chart is in the safe and signed by her, maybe that suggests she was involved with the chart after she left. Wait, she quit in January, so the chart from June (half a year later) would be after her employment. But if the chart is signed by her, that would mean she had access to it after she quit, which contradicts her statement that she hadn't been back until that day. Wait, but the testimony in Testimony 4 is her questioning why she would go now for a half-year-old chart, implying she didn't go for that reason. But if the chart is signed by her and found in the safe, maybe she did access it recently. Let me check the timeline.

The victim's autopsy report says time of death is June 14, after 10 PM. Alita quit in January, so if the chart is from June (as per Evidence 13: Wocky's Check-Up Report from June), then the chart in the safe (Evidence 18) signed by her would be from June. That suggests she was involved in creating or updating the chart in June, even though she claims she hadn't been back until the day of the incident (which is June 14). That would contradict her Testimony 0 where she says she went to the clinic that day for the first time in half a year. So if she signed the chart in June, she must have been there before June 14, which would contradict her testimony that she hadn't been there since January. So Evidence 18 (Wocky's Chart signed by her) contradicts Testimony 0.

Alternatively, maybe Testimony 4 is the contradiction. Testimony 4: "Why would I go to the clinic now for a half-year-old chart?" If the chart is from June (which is current month) and she signed it, then it's not a half-year-old chart. Wait, if she quit in January, then the chart from June would be 5-6 months later. If she signed the chart in June, then she would have had to be at the clinic after she quit, which contradicts her statement in Testimony 0 that she hadn't been there since quitting until the day of the incident. So Evidence 18 shows she was there to sign the chart in June, which is within the six months (January to June is five months, so "half a year" is six months). So if she quit in January, and the chart is from June, that's five months later. So "half a year" might be approximate. But her testimony says she went that day (June 14) for the first time in half a year. If she had been there in June before June 14 to sign the chart, that would contradict Testimony 0. But if the chart was created on June 14, then maybe she signed it that day. Wait, the Check-Up Report (Evidence 13) is from June, but the Chart (Evidence 18) is found in the safe. If the chart is from June and she signed it, but she claims she hadn't been to the clinic since January until that day (June 14), then the only time she could have signed it is on June 14. But why would she sign a chart that's in the safe? Maybe the chart was created on the day of the incident. But if she was there to warn the doctor and left, why would she sign a chart? Alternatively, maybe the chart was created earlier but signed later. Hmm, this is getting a bit complicated.

Alternatively, let's look at Evidence 16: Alita's Sandals found in the clinic foyer with a big toe print on the left sandal. The slippers (Evidence 3) found at Kitaki Mansion have a big toe print in the left slipper. If both have the same print, that might link her to the slippers at the mansion. But how does that relate to her testimonies?

Wait, Evidence 3: Slippers from the clinic found at Kitaki Mansion, with big toe print. Evidence 16: Alita's sandals in the clinic with a big toe print. If the prints match, that suggests she was wearing the slippers, which were taken to the mansion. But her testimony says she went to the clinic, warned him, and left. If her sandals were left there, maybe she was there longer or involved in something else. But how does that contradict her testimony?

Another angle: Testimony 6 says "Nothing happened at all. I warned him, and left." But if there's evidence like the Lamp (Evidence 17) with a broken bulb and red stain, maybe indicating a struggle. But that's not directly linked to her.

Looking back, the key contradiction is likely between her claim that she hadn't been to the clinic since January (Testimony 0) and the existence of a chart signed by her in June (Evidence 18). Because signing the chart would require her to have been at the clinic after she quit. Therefore, Evidence 18 (Wocky's Chart signed by Alita) contradicts Testimony 0 (first visit in half a year on that day). But wait, if she went on the day of the incident (June 14) and signed the chart then, that would fit. Unless the chart was created earlier. Wait, the chart is found in the safe. If the chart was from a check-up in June, as per Evidence 13 (Wocky's Check-Up Report), which is from June, then the chart in the safe (Evidence 18) would be from June. If Alita signed it, then she must have been present at the clinic in June to do so. But she claims she hadn't been there since January until that day (June 14). So if the chart was signed by her on June 14, that's possible. But maybe the chart was part of her duties when she was a nurse. However, she quit in January. So if the chart is from June, and she signed it, that would mean she was working there again, which contradicts her quitting. Alternatively, maybe the chart is old, but signed by her when she was still employed. But Testimony 4 says "Why would I go to the clinic now for a half-year-old chart?" implying the chart is from six months ago. But if the chart is from June (current month), then it's not half a year old. So if the chart is recent (June), her Testimony 4 is a lie because she's implying she has no reason to go for an old chart, but the chart is actually new. Therefore, Evidence 18 (the chart signed by her in June) contradicts Testimony 4 where she claims she wouldn't go for a half-year-old chart. Because the chart is not half a year old, it's current, so her statement is false. That's the contradiction. So the pair would be Evidence 18 and Testimony 4.

{"evidence": 18, "testimony": 4}
